seo.title: Where to Eat in Positano: Hostel Brikette Dining Guide
seo.description: Plan meals around Hostel Brikette with local restaurant tips, transport notes, price ranges, and bucket-list dining experiences.

linkLabel: Where to Eat in Positano: Casual to Celebration
heroAlt: Dinner on a terrace overlooking Positano
intro: Positano is packed with restaurants ranging from simple pizza counters to celebratory tasting menus. Prices rise as you head towards the main beach, so balance your plans between neighbourhood staples and destination dining.

Reserve tables online through services like TheFork whenever possible and aim to confirm for 20:30–22:00, when dining rooms are busiest. For last-minute meals, keep a few walk-in options uphill from the waterfront.

sections.title: Signature experiences
body: La Gavitella sits across the bay in Praiano and combines a beach club afternoon with a seafood dinner. Ride the Positano main beach shuttle boat over for a scenic arrival, or take the Amalfi-bound SITA bus and walk down from the stop. Expect exceptionally fresh catch and sunset views over Capri.

For an unforgettable splurge, book the Sunset Cruise and Dinner. The outing includes a boat cruise, the coastal sunset, and a multi-course seafood feast for about €139 per person—ideal for special occasions or group celebrations.

sections.title: Farmhouse feasts above Positano
body: La Tagliata sits 3 km uphill near Montepertuso and Nocelle. Take the local bus toward Nocelle and hop off shortly after Montepertuso, or arrange the restaurant’s shuttle. The fixed menu covers antipasti, homemade pasta, grilled meats, wine, and dessert for roughly €65 per person.

La Taverna del Leone near Laurito and Il Ritrovo in Montepertuso round out the classic countryside trattoria circuit. Both are reachable by the Amalfi-bound bus and offer relaxed service with generous portions in the €45–55 range.

sections.title: Neighbourhood favourites around the hostel
body: Within a few minutes of Hostel Brikette you have casual go-tos like C’era Una Volta (pizza al taglio from €7–12) and Il Grottino Azzurro, only 160 metres away for homemade specials around €35. Da Gabrisa, Next2, and Da Costantino each add sit-down dinners with sea views for €30–60.

Further downhill, Luna at Villa Magia and Da Vincenzo 1958 deliver refined dining with scenic terraces; budget €65–100 per person and request a window table when booking. Keep the interno bus in mind for the steep return uphill from beach-level spots like Buca di Bacco.

essentials: C’era Una Volta – across from the hostel; takeaway pizza €7–12.
Il Grottino Azzurro – 160 m flat walk; dinner about €35.
Da Gabrisa – 260 m downhill; terrace views, around €60.
Next2 – 270 m downhill; modern Italian menu for about €60.
Da Costantino – 300 m uphill; window seats with €30 set menus.
Luna at Villa Magia – 450 m downhill; fine dining near €100.
Da Vincenzo 1958 – 500 m downhill; classic Positano dishes for €65.
Ohimà – 1.1 km downhill; take the interno bus, expect €75.
Al Palazzo – 1.2 km downhill; al fresco courtyard, ~€75.
Buca di Bacco – main beach; best beachfront pick around €50.
Il Ritrovo – Montepertuso; bus access, about €55.
La Taverna del Leone – Laurito; Amalfi bus stop nearby, €45.
La Gavitella – Praiano boat transfer; seafood feast about €50.
Sunset Cruise & Dinner – boat experience with meal, €139.
La Tagliata – Montepertuso shuttle; farmhouse banquet for €65.
typicalCosts: Takeaway pizza or panini near the hostel: €7–12.
Neighbourhood trattorias with wine and dessert: €30–60 per person.
Destination tasting menus or cruises: €65–139 per person.
tips: Reserve online or by phone for 20:30–22:00 seatings—the busiest window for Positano restaurants.
Use SITA or interno buses, or restaurant shuttles like La Tagliata’s, to avoid long stair climbs after dinner.
Carry some cash for smaller venues and tips, even when cards are accepted.
If you plan to swim before dining at La Gavitella, pack a dry change of clothes for the return boat.

faqs.q: How do I get to La Gavitella from Hostel Brikette?
a: Head to the main beach and take the shuttle boat directly to the restaurant for a scenic arrival, or ride the SITA bus toward Amalfi and hop off part way, then follow the stairs down to the beach club.

faqs.q: Does La Tagliata offer transport back to Positano?
a: Yes. Arrange the restaurant’s shuttle when you book or confirm your dinner so you can ride back after the multi-course feast without worrying about late buses.
